derivation.yuyuan_name: mid 17th cent. (in the sense 'perform, practise'): from Latin exserere 'put forth', from ex- 'out' + serere 'bind'

entry.tran: 施加（影响、压力等）;行使，运用（权威等）
entry.def: If someone or something exerts influence, authority, or pressure, they use it in a strong or determined way, especially in order to produce a particular effect.

example.ex: He exerted considerable influence on the thinking of the scientific community on these issues...
example.tran: 他极大地影响了科学界对这些问题的看法。

example.ex: The cyst was causing swelling and exerting pressure on her brain.
example.tran: 那个囊肿正在引起肿胀，压迫着她的大脑。

entry.def: If you exert yourself, you make a great physical or mental effort, or work hard to do something.

example.ex: Youngsters get so absorbed that they don't realise how much they're exerting themselves...
example.tran: 年轻人如此地沉浸其中，他们没有意识到自己有多么努力。

means.word_mean: 3. make a great effort at a mental or physical task;

stems_affixes.word_buile: assert[v.断言,宣称;坚持;主张[权利,权威等]]+ive……的→adj.言语果断的,断言的
de离开+sert加入,插入,连接→不再加入→抛弃→沙漠[无连接,联系的地方]
insert[v.插入,嵌入;登载 n.插入物]+ion表名词→n.插入,插入物

stems_affixes.value_cn: 断言,宣称;坚持;主张[权利,权威等]
stems_affixes.word_buile: as加强+sert加入,插入,连接→强行加入[观点]→断言
de离开+sert加入,插入,连接→不再加入→抛弃→沙漠[无连接,联系的地方]
ex出,表示超出+sert加入,插入,连接→exert尽[力],努力
ex出+sert加入,插入,连接→插出去→突出

Sentence.sentence: Swedish family-friendly policies tend to exert a negative influence on women's careers.
Oil prices may exert influence not only on American government policies but on how energy is used in the nation.
Rising population combined with improved nutrition standards and shifting dietary preferences will exert pressure for increases in global food supply.

sentences.en: He never exerts himself to help anyone.
